so idk if i missed anything

i dont mean i tell you what visuals to make, just some help how to realize it
I feel like I would be better at making an atmosphere than a good game
you can make good visuals without learning shaders
99% of people in the community who "learned shaders" just learned how to port shaders from shadertoy
i know a bunch of people who do that 4Head
orange attack is a bitrate moment XD
i feel like most of the time shadertoy shaders look out of place
I personally would rather make individual pixels the way i want than use shaders
because people dont properly integrate them into the visuals
though they are a good tool
qt thats insanity for animated stuff

time to go back to mc grinds and glance when I hear jinmenusagi
but there are only 3 clears right? i don't think they're *that* common
yall trying to like be the center cherry
I finally rebeat save 2 in ATK2 for recording
and then I got 3 good attempts at save 4
For having not played the game in about a year, it actually went pretty damn well
I got to the post-trigger jump 3 times

Honestly, for only playing it for an hour and a half after not touching it for a year, and also considering I'm not pause buffering at all now, I was playing almost as good as I was when I was at the peak of the grind originally
So like, honestly, if I just fucking played it, I think I could clear it quickly
I yearn for the days when fucking, like, Syobon Action or Megaman 2 were some of the hardest games I could think of
you know what else happened in 2013? K3 release lol
You know, it's pretty weird when you think about it
beating my dad in HoMM5 is probably harder than beating hendeca
so I guess that was the first hard thing I did
Cause like, K3 is generally considered to be a very high quality and production game
and so to think it came out literally almost a decade ago now
well, the 2013 release was only up to influka area, and close to the end of 2013
It's weird when I think about how I played OG guy when it came out
and like, at the time, OG guy was considered to be so fucking crazy lol
to think that K3 was closer to the original release of IWBTG than we are to the release of K3
That's something I find to be honestly really surprising when I think more deeply about it
I don't really understand IWBTG's reputation
there are MANY old games way harder than it
I played OG guy, and the original 3 most well known fangames all each when they came out, having absolutely 0 knowledge of the intricacies of "fangames" as a whole
I mean, if we are being honest, even in regards to other games of the times, even indie games, IWBTG wasnt that hard
and now, over a decade after that, I religiously ONLY play fangames p much lol
but yeah, given that you're expected to die a lot, that sort of gives an allure of difficulty
it's kinda like cat mario in a way
yeah I guess when you measure difficulty purely by deathcount then IWBTG is p hard
There were definitely a lot of games harder than IWBTG back then
but I think IWBTG was unique in that it was a platformer where the entire shtick is that it's like, unfair I guess
and now youre all cracked at fangames
if all fangames were like the og guy i wouldnt be playing fangames now
but relatively speaking, IWBTG also had pretty smooth controls
and I think that adds something to it
After all, fangames in general have some of the best feeling controls of just about anything I've played
Can't really beat how precise they are
yeah, specially compared to a lot of the other "rage games" in the same sort of vein, it controlled really well
fangames have insanely good controls yeah
i like how the kid stops moving when you stop holding shif/left/right
whereas in most other platforms the character has momentum
it allows you to be more precise
I've always maintained that IWBTG fangames have the best controls of any platforming game that has ever been made
the jumping in original guy was admittedly a bit weird
They're very easy to learn, but hard to master
but when you master them, they're perfectly responsive
ehh, I personally think that the kid;s controls lack a bit of dynamism
don't force yourself to get to mayumushi
doing stuff in celeste or dustforce will pretty much always feel better imo, plus theres a ton more tech you can do while still being really tight
I don't think kid controls are hard to master
Well what I more-so mean is
unless we mean hard to master in the way anything is hard to master
Left, right, restart, shift is jump and depending on how many frames you press shift, higher jump, etc.
it's hard to master in the way of getting good at cancels and precise tech
but mastering that "frame heights" part, and also pressing left and right in quick response to certain things like a TAS drop is hard
the kid's controlls are basically as simple as you can make platformer's control while having depth of maneuver imo
but when you can, you feel like you can do anything
I mean I think that's just saying hard things are hard
and given that simplicity, theyre also really well executed
has nothing to do with the controls
Its really easy to get a solid grip of the kids controls tbh
you want to play something with truly hard to master controls? play dustforce
nick im still on that noah save
youll feel like a beginner for like, the first 100+ hours
i dont get the last jump
Dustforce definitely do be like that lmao
steep as hell difficulty curve tho
